dialogues.text: Sounds of protest fill the room as the BAILIFFS start to out the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: INT. COURTROOM LATER
dialogues.text: The gallery is empty.  Only Dulaney, Rebecca, Cardenas, Troxell, Roston, Judge Burnham, The Jury and Court Offici remain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did she do next, Mr. Roston?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She started touching herself and telling me how much she wanted me. She reached down and put me inside her.  My doctor had warned me about exerting myself -- but you really don't think of those things at a moment like that.  You just think about how beautiful this woman is -- how much you want her.  How deeply you want to please her. (beat) At first it started off slowly -- but the rhythm built and built.    Every time I got close to an orgasm she would stop.  Eventually I started to have trouble breathing.  Rebecca just kept going -- faster and faster.  No matter what I said she wouldn't stop. I really thought for a moment I was going to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you knew it was bad for you why did you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't help myself.  You get lost inside a women like her.  It was like a drug.  It was the best sex I ever had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened after that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I woke up the next morning and she was gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you change your will while you were with Miss Lawson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was your primary beneficiary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  The State rests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Dulaney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney is stunned -- deep in thought.  He doesn't appear hear the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Dulaney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney looks at the jury.  What he sees isn't good.  He for a moment.  He leans over and quickly speaks with Rebe We cannot hear them -- but their conversation is heated. Rebecca says something.  Dulaney looks at Roston.  A beat Dulaney stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Roston, you said it was the best sex you ever had.  Is that the best sex with a woman, or a man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cardenas bolts from his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll rephrase the question.  Mr. Roston isn't it true you are bisexual?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection!  Mr. Roston's sexual preferences are not at issue in this trial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, I'm trying to establish the sense of betrayal Miss Lawson felt when she discovered the man she lived with was a different person than she thought he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge Burnham thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witness will answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Roston?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your sexual tastes were something that you hid from Miss Lawson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And didn't Miss Lawson come home one day and find you in bed with your male lover?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she left shortly after that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.  Roston thinks, struggling to make a decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  We worked things out.  It was three weeks later when I told her about the heart surgery that she left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roston looks around the court room.  He is embarrassed, f with emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it be fair to say that when she did find out it was a shock to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very upset) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No further questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roston looks at the jury -- their disapproving stares.  H on the verge of tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca opens the door.  A tired-looking Dulaney enters. walk to the couch together in silence.  Dulaney sits.  Re lifts a BOTTLE of CHAMPAGNE out of an ice bucket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To celebrate how masterfully you destroyed Roston today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca -- we shattered a man's life in open court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly ice cold) Fuck him!  He tried to shatter mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was only doing what he thought was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too weak, Frank.  When you want something you have to do what- ever it takes to get it.  If something gets in your way you remove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney stares at her.  The person he sees has no feeling no empathy for anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed him -- didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you were thinking that.  I could see it in your eyes today in the courtroom.  You're wrong, Frank. I need you to believe that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do need you.  No matter what you think of me -- I didn't do it. (beat) I could see the looks on the juror's faces.  To the men I represent what they can never have.  I'm a cold, heartless bitch -- and this is their chance for pay-back for every woman that's ever blown them off in a bar. To the old women I'm a vulgar whore and to the young ones I remind them of what they'll never be.  It doesn't matter to them that I'm innocent. They've already convicted me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dropping the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter of factly) No -- you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca picks up a REMOTE CONTROL from the coffee table a pushes a button.

dialogues.speaker: TELEVISION
dialogues.text: A TAPE of Dulaney making love to Rebecca fills the screen is wild, passionate.

dialogues.speaker: DULANEY
dialogues.text: he is dumbfounded as he watches.  The implications of wha tape could do to him run through his mind. Something in Dulaney snaps.  He grabs Rebecca.  They stru falling down onto the coffee table.  The CHAMPAGNE bottle crashes to the floor.  Rebecca rolls off the table to the floor.  She sits up and moves away from Dulaney by pushin herself backwards.  Dulaney lunges at her.  His hand grab her ankle.  Rebecca kicks -- breaks free -- stands up.  D gets to his feet -- runs after her.  He grabs her by the and smashes her into the wall.  He slaps her across the f A thin stream of blood flows from the corner of her mouth smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gets easier, doesn't it?  Once you open the door it never closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney realizes what he is doing.  He stares at her in h then walks towards the door. He stops.  Goes back to the machine.  He pushes the EJECT BUTTON on the VCR, removes tape and destroys it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got another copy.  How do you think your wife would feel if she saw this -- not to mention your colleagues?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney's temper is near the breaking point again, he str to control himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can think whatever you want, Frank -- but I didn't kill Andrew, and I'm not going to prison for something I didn't do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I'm a survivor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney, Sharon and Michael sit at the table eating dinne There is a tense silence.  Although Michael does not know is going on he can sense the tension.  The DOORBELL RINGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney answers the front door and Biggs rushes in excite

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to barge in -- but I figured after that bombshell that got laid on you today you could use some good news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got something on the Coke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biggs grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I?  I talked to one of the dealers I put the word out to.  He's been following the trial pretty closely. He said at one time he wanted to be a lawyer before he became a dealer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie -- are you going to make a point soon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now.  Guess who's been buying Coke from him for the last five and half years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney shrugs his shoulders indicating he doesn't have a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marsh's secretary -- Joanne Braslow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confusion fills Dulaney's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Court is in session.  Rebecca looks around the courtroom, trying to get a feel of the CROWD'S opinion.  Dulaney is there.  She looks at the door anxiously.  The rooms waits beat.  Dulaney enters -- sits beside Rebecca -- but acts she isn't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney stands at the witness stand in front of an ORIENT in his thirties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Wong -- what type of medicine do you practice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oriental medicine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --And is Miss Lawson a patient of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I've been seeing her for over a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does she come to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She suffers from severe menstrual cramps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever prescribe any medication for her cramps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you prescribe for her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chinese peony root.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you describe for the court what Chinese peony root looks like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a white powder that comes in a vial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a MOAN from the CROWD.  Cardenas looks at Troxel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you instruct your patients to take it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell them to pour an amount the size of a quarter into the their hand and mix it with water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A previous witness stated that she saw Miss Lawson pouring a white powder into her hand on October twenty-eighth.  According to your records when did you prescribe the drug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Wong checks his records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: October twenty-seventh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One last question, Doctor.  If someone didn't know better, would it be easy to mistake the peony root for cocaine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- quite easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cardenas) Your witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cardenas realizes there is nothing to gain by examining t witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may call your next witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The defense calls Miss Margaret Sellers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cardenas looks worried as he watches an attractive woman mid twenties approach the stand.

dialogues.speaker: DULANEY AND MISS SELLERS
dialogues.text: Miss Sellers appears a little nervous.  Dulaney smiles wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Sellers, do you know Dr. Alan Paley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you meet him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a nurse.  I used to work at Roseburg Memorial Hospital.  Dr. Paley's on staff there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the nature of your relationship with Dr. Paley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We dated for about a month last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realized he wasn't serious.  He was seeing other women -- asking other nurses at the hospital out, so I ended it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And what did Dr. Paley do after you stopped seeing him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He used to call me -- tell me that I couldn't just walk out on him.  He said that if I didn't come back he'd make my life miserable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he make your life miserable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cardenas stands again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection!  May I remind Mr. Dulaney that the person on trial here is Miss Lawson -- not Dr. Paley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, I'm trying to establish a pattern in Dr. Paley's behavior with women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection overruled.  The witness will answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd call me in the middle of the night.  Show up at my house and bang on the door.  Finally after two weeks I went to his office one day to tell him to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughed -- and basically said he would decide when it was over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember his exact words?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  He said, "If you want to play games, we'll play -- and you'll be sorry."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another BUZZ from the CROWD.   Cardenas inwardly cringes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While I was seeing Dr. Paley I mentioned to him one night that someone was stealing drugs from the third floor dispensary.   Three days after I spoke to him in his office he went to the Head Nurse and told her he had witnessed me stealing drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was an inquiry.  It was his word against mine.  They believed him.  I was fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney is at his desk.  Biggs enters excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joanne Braslow is getting more and more interesting.  I followed her today to an attorney's office. Joseph Koehler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe Koehler.  I know him.  He's an estate attorney -- and he's very expensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would Joanne Braslow need with an estate attorney?  She wasn't even mentioned in Marsh's will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney thinks for a moment.  He grins as an idea enters mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney and Biggs sit at a table going through a stack of papers.  Dulaney traces his finger along a piece of paper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it is!  According to the old will Joanne Braslow was to inherit two hundred and fifty thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What good does that do -- it's the old will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the law a person cannot profit from their own wrong doing.  Since Rebecca Lawson is the sole beneficiary of the new will, if she is found guilty the will is void and Joanne Braslow could make a very good case to have the old will reinstated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kills the old man and makes it look like Miss Lawson did it.  Pretty slick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney is washing up for dinner.  He speaks to Sharon wh in the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking that when the trial is over we'd all go skiing for a weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it would be a good idea if you just took Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharon leaves the room.  Dulaney reaches for his TOOTHBRU picks up a TUBE of TOOTH PASTE.  It is empty.  He stares EMPTY TUBE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Drug store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney looks worn, tired -- the tension between him and Rebecca shows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Dulaney, are you ready to call your next witness?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney doesn't seem to hear him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Dulaney, are you with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney snaps out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Your Honor.  The defense recalls Joanne Braslow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Joanne walks towards the stand Dulaney looks over at Rebecca.  It's as if he is trying to make up his mind abo her.  Joanne takes her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Braslow, I'd like to remind you that you are still under oath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How often do you use cocaine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cardenas shoots out of his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection, Your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently) Counsel approach the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney and Cardenas walk over to the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Dulaney, I'm getting tired of seeing you this close to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge Burnham looks at Cardenas indicating he will hear h argument now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whether or not Miss Braslow uses drugs is not an issue here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor -- the prosecution has introduced cocaine as one of the contributing reasons Mr. Marsh died. How it may have been introduced into the household is of vital importance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you able to back up this allegation -- or are you fishing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can back it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better. (to Joanne) Please answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've tried it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've tried it?  Isn't it true that you've been in and out of Rehab centers for the last four years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is clearly embarrassing for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been to a few -- yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like Miss Lawson much do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitantly) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like her because you were involved with Mr. Marsh before she came along.  Isn't that true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You resented the fact that she told you what to do in Mr. Marsh's house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney moves the questions along, quickening their pace, building a rhythm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you resented that he cared for her in a way he once cared for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking down) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --And that Mr. Marsh paid less attention to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and that he changed his will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has blurted out the answer before the full implicatio the question has dawned on her.  Her face reveals her mis Cardenas can only watch uncomfortably from his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his previous will Mr. Marsh left you two hundred and fifty thousand dollars -- then he cut you out.  Why do you think he did that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She talked him into it.  She wanted everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred and fifty thousand dollars is a lot of money.  That must have made you pretty angry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney picks up a small PIECE OF PAPER and walks towards Joanne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You testified that you returned to Mr. Marsh's house at eleven o'clock the night of his murder.  Is that correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - I'm a little confused. (holds up the paper) This is a charge receipt from Rosen's Drug Store where Mr. Marsh had an account.  It's dated the day of the murder. (hands it to her) Is this your signature?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously studies it) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an item you picked up that's marked.  Will you read it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dristan nasal spray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you read for us the time of the purchase?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A.M -- or P.M.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that's what bothers me.  No other bottle of nasal spray was found in the house.  The police looked. There was only the one bottle.  But you say you didn't arrive until after Mr. Marsh was dead -- yet we know he was using the nasal spray prior to his death.  How do you think it got there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it true that you stopped by the house after you left the drug store and dropped off the items you bought?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it true that you put the cocaine in the bottle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Why would I want to kill him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you were jealous.  Because he cut you out of the will.  Because you have a cocaine habit to feed -- because you know that if Rebecca Lawson is found guilty the new will is void -- and there's a very good chance the old one would be honored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE fills the room.  Members of the JURY look at Rebe they are confused -- doubt fills their minds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The defense rests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.  Dulaney is standing by the window, watching the RA FALL outside.  Sharon enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't go on like this, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney continues to stare out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his NO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please -- this is ripping us apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotionally) I can't talk about it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She senses his pain and moves to him, wrapping her arms a his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shut me out.  Let me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and faces her.  She can see the pain on his face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't like what you'd see. You don't know me anymore.  I don't know me anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't pretend this isn't happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please -- not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you come to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You used to like to touch me -- to make love to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more involved than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a place to start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that's the answer?  Sex? Is that what you want?  You want me to make love to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want our lives ruined because of this.  I love you, Frank.  I want this to work -- but you have to help me.  You have to come back from where ever it is you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney's confusion and emotion begins to surface.  She k him, softly, gently.  Dulaney closes his eyes.  He kisses harder - and harder.  His passion builds -- his anger gro He runs his arm over his desk, brushing everything to the floor. He grabs her and firmly pushes her down on the desk.  He her forcefully, his lips pressed hard against hers.  She struggles against him.  His hands tear at her blouse.  It rough, angry sex and it frightens Sharon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Frank -- stop it!  Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this what you want -- huh?  Is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is crying now -- struggling futilely against him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go!  Godammit, Frank let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (racked with fear) Daddy -- stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney stops and looks. Michael is standing in the doorway, his face filled with and incomprehension.  Tears streak down his face. Dulaney freezes as the full power of his actions overwhel His face floods with anguish as he tries to grasp the tot effect of his behavior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Oh -- Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled with pain and embarrassment Dulaney runs from the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAIN falls in sheets.  Dulaney sits inside the small stru huddled against one of the pillars.  He is a tragic figur desperately trying to claw his way back to the world he o knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAIN continues to fall.  Dulaney is standing across the s staring at the house.  He crosses over and is half way to door when he stops.  He starts to leave. The front door opens and Sharon steps out onto the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns around slowly.  He can't bring himself to look a She walks out into the rain.  He lifts his head.  Tears f down his face and he cries.  When she begins to cry with he breaks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ashamed) I'm sorry.  God -- I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly drops to his knees -- holding on to her as if s were a strong tree in a wind-storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me.  Please -- help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney sits beside Rebecca. There is tension between the does not look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Dulaney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney stands and walks over to the jury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prosecution's case is built on theory -- speculation.  Could Rebecca Lawson have done this?  Is it possible that she did that? Where are the facts?  The evidence.  The State has presented two spurned lovers and a jealous secretary.  Hardly what I would call impartial witnesses. Where is one shred of conclusive, irrefutable evidence?  I don't see it -- and I don't think you do either. Do you know why?  Because there isn't any. (beat) What's the issue here?  That Rebecca Lawson likes wild sex?  No.  But the District Attorney is trying to make you think if Rebecca Lawson could stray from the path of normal, accepted sexual behavior, then she could be capable of murder.  Did she force Andrew Marsh to make love to her?  Did she hold a gun to his head? No.  Andrew Marsh wanted her -- and why wouldn't he?  She's beautiful, alluring -- the type of woman men dream about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Dulaney continues we sense he is applying his closing arguments to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's human nature.  We want what we want -- when we want it.  We don't think about the consequences of our actions.  When desire fills us we all do things that we know are bad for us.  We live for the moment. (beat) Here was an exciting young woman who unlocked doors.  Doors that led into a new world.  A world he entered willingly -- eagerly.  He wanted to please her -- and so, he did not tell her of his illness.  I know it might be difficult for you to understand wanting something so badly that you are willing to risk everything -- but that's what passion does to you. It's a fire -- uncontrollable.  It consumes you -- and the only thing you can do is let it burn.  Andrew Marsh let it burn.  It was his life - - his choice -- and maybe his mistake -- but making love is not a crime. (beat) We all have fires inside us -- secret desires.  We guard them --hold them in the cages that we've built.  When someone comes along and opens the gate, they rush out and feed blindly on their pleasure.  Rebecca Lawson loved Andrew Marsh.  She didn't kill him -- if anything did, it was his own passion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney walks back to his table and sits down.  Rebecca l at him warmly.  Dulaney does not look at her.  Cardenas s to address the jury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true -- we all have fires burning inside us.  Rebecca Lawson was very aware of the fire burning inside Andrew Marsh -- and she stoked those flames -- fanning them until they burned so hot that reason and judgement left him.  Is making love a crime?  Of course not -- but the question isn't as simple as that. Rebecca Lawson used her seductive qualities to entice Andrew Marsh. She used sex as a catalyst and cocaine as the terminus.  The combination of the two provided the conclusion of a premeditated act. (beat) She asked Dr. Paley about cocaine. Her fingerprints were found on the nasal spray bottle that contained the cocaine -- and she was the sole beneficiary of Andrew Marsh's will. She planned it from beginning to end. She knew about his heart.  She secretly administered cocaine, then used wild and physically demanding sex to induce a heart attack. (beat) Making love is an act of passion between two people to affirm their vows of love.  This was not an act of love -- this was an act of greed. This was betrayal.  Rebecca Lawson killed Andrew Marsh -- and I'm counting on you to punish her for that crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney sits on one side of the room -- Rebecca on the ot The room is quiet -- tense.  A MAN enters and nods to him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to man) They're back already?  It's only been three hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney sits beside Rebecca.  In the row behind them is S and Biggs. The JURY enters.  Their faces betray nothing.  One by one file into their seats. Cardenas sits with Troxell -- both of them watching anxio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen of the jury, have you reached a verdict?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JURY FOREMAN stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have, Your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BAILIFF walks over and takes the VERDICT SLIP from th FOREMAN, then walks over to Judge Burnham and hands it to Judge Burnham reads the decision.  He hands it back to th Bailiff who takes it to the COURT CLERK.

dialogues.speaker: ON REBECCA
dialogues.text: She waits nervously for the Court Clerk to read the verdi

dialogues.speaker: ON CARDENAS
dialogues.text: he taps his pen against the desk anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE COURT CLERK
dialogues.text: He opens the verdict slip and looks at it.  He stands slo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jury finds the defendant -- not guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relief floods Rebecca's face.  Dulaney shows no emotion. Sattler and Biggs shakes hands, then lean forward to congratulate Dulaney. Rebecca turns to Dulaney to hug him -- before she can, Du has picked up his briefcase and is leaving the courtroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney walks towards his car with Biggs.  There is no se victory or elation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take some time off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think the D.A.'s gonna file on Joanne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney reaches his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did a good job, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mister D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biggs walks away.  Dulaney takes out his keys, opens the to his car.  He is about to get in when he senses someone behind him.  He turns around. Joanne steps out from behind a pillar.  She stares at Dul hatefully.  Her hand is inside her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bastard should have left me something.  I worked for him for six years -- and he goes and gives it all to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney looks around the parking lot.  He is alone.  Joan obviously very high on something.  Her mind seems to wand her eyes drift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take what people say and make it ugly.  You make others believe what you want them to.  She should have been found guilty.  She shouldn't have gotten off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you would have gotten your money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed him -- didn't you, Joanne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think if I did I'd be stupid enough to tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney looks her hand fidgeting in her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you have in your purse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think I've got?  A gun? Maybe I'm gonna kill you too.  Maybe I'll blow your head off right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her hand starts to come out of the purse.  Suddenly, Bigg appears, rushing her from behind a pillar.  He grabs her and pushes her against a car. He pulls her hand from the purse.  She is holding a piece paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) I'm gonna go to jail.  I know they're gonna make it look like I did it. They gotta put it on someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you come here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up the letter) To show you this.  It's a letter from that lawyer, Koehler.  He wrote it to me the day after I saw him.  He's the one who told me I could get the money if Miss Lawson went to jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't know about it before that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney is suddenly very confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why did you go see Mr. Koehler in the first place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he called me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney is stunned.  He looks at Biggs with a knowing sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is RAINING lightly.  Dulaney waits at the door of a ni story home.  It is answered by a heavy-set man in his fif JOSEPH KOEHLER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank -- what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to ask you a question.  What made you get in touch with Joanne Braslow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I can't talk about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not asking for names or specifics.  I just want to know what prompted you to make the call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Koehler starts to close the door, Dulaney sticks his foot inside, blocking it.  His face is filled with determinati Koehler sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please -- I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Koehler thinks for a moment.  He can sense Dulaney's need

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I can tell you is I was contacted by an interested party on Miss Braslow's behalf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney stares through the windshield, straining to see t road through the heavy rain.  His CAR PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank -- It's Rebecca.  I need to see you right away.  I've got the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A calmness spreads over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAIN FALLS.  LIGHTNING fills the sky.  Dulaney drives up finds a PARKING SPOT down the street --  gets out of his and runs to the door.  As he KNOCKS as loud CLAP on THUND BOOMS overhead.  Dulaney waits impatiently.  He lifts the FLOWER POT, removes the key and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dim glow of a DESK LAMP is the only source of light. Dulaney moves through the room slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two CHAMPAGNE BOTTLES are on the floor by the couch.  Dul looks on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: COFFEE TABLE
dialogues.text: A VIAL is open and on its side.  A RAZOR BLADE and STRAW next to it.  A pile of WHITE POWDER has been dumped out. Several lines of cocaine have been drawn. Dulaney starts to move towards the living room.  He is al at the door when the BIG SCREEN TELEVISION TURNS ON.  We the tape of Dulaney and Rebecca making love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this what you're looking for, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney turns around to find Rebecca standing behind him, remote control in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distant) You killed him.  You killed him -- and I got you off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it?  Joanne Braslow was perfect, wasn't she?  You knew we'd see her on the tape and find out about her coke problem.  After that, the digging should have been easy -- but we missed the will.  You knew we were following her, so you called Koehler and had him contact her.  That put us right back on track.  All we needed then was to prove that she had an opportunity.  The drug store took care of that.  She dropped off the stuff and you came back and killed him.  Didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shrugs her shoulders.  His frustration clearly amuses She grins slightly, almost taunting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney starts into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking about that.  I've decided to give it to you after I've collected the inheritance.  You can take that one if you want -- but there's another copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't the deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (provoking him) So, sue me. (as cold as ice) Things have changed.  I think you should go home -- and after you leave I see no reason for us to ever have contact again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growing angrier) I'm not leaving without that tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't push me, Frank.  I might lose my temper and send it out just for spite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney loses control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuckin' bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her by the shoulders and pushes her into the wal Rebecca struggles, but it is little use -- he is a man co with rage.  Dulaney continues to smash her into the wall. Rebecca reaches onto the desk -- lifts up a FOUNTAIN PEN stabs it into Dulaney's shoulder at the base of his neck. Dulaney SCREAMS and lets go.  Rebecca starts to runs into living room.  Dulaney follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney catches Rebecca -- grabs her -- spins her around then backhands her across the face, knocking her to the g In the b.g. the VIDEO of them in bed plays on the screen. Dulaney sits on top of her and grabs her by the hair.  He repeatedly smashes her head onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney stops.  He looks behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in the bedroom doorway is Dr. Paley.  He is hold GUN at Dulaney. Dulaney stares at him with disbelief as he staggers to hi feet, his hand holding the wound on his shoulder.  A shor breathless LAUGH drifts out of Dulaney as he starts to pu all together.  Rebecca stands up, holding her head as she to catch her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rebecca) Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca NODS.  Her face hardens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to kill him, Alan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right, Paley.  You've got to kill me.  She doesn't have to -- she's free -- she can't be tried again -- but you, you planned it with her.  You supplied the Coke.  You're an accessory to murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paley struggles to make a decision.  The gun shakes in hi hand.  Suddenly, the whole scheme becomes clear to Dulane

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see what she's doing?  She needs you to kill me.  She's planned it that way from the start.  That's why she phoned me tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You called him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- he's lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it supposed to work Rebecca? You and Paley celebrate your victory. You get me over here and provoke a fight so he has to rush in and save you -- but then he's given himself away as your accomplice -- now he has to kill me. (to Paley) After that I figure she'll tell the Police that you broke in.  That you were crazed because we humiliated you in court?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't listen to him.  Can't you see he's trying to turn you against me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; to Paley) Here's the good part.  The truth dies with me and she turns State's evidence against you.  It won't matter what you say.  No one will believe your version -- you've already discredited yourself in court.  You'll go away forever and she'll have the money all for herself.  She's played us both perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paley is becoming more and more confused.  Dulaney moves towards him.  Paley lowers the gun slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan, listen to me.  If you don't kill him it's over.  Everything we did will be for nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Rebecca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's good isn't she?  But maybe with you it's the real thing. (points to the screen) I'm sure all those nights she was fuckin' me she was thinking of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confusion crowds Paley's mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure that every orgasm she had with me was faked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean she only screwed me two or three times a night because she had to -- I'm sure she didn't enjoy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) I love you, Alan.  You have to believe I love you.  Kill him!  Kill him and we can be together forever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, she loves you.  Just like she loved Roston and Marsh and me.  Don't be a fool.  You're nothing to her.  The second you pull that trigger she'll turn on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betrayal fills Paley's face.  His eyes fill with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rebecca) I loved you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tense) Alan, don't let him do this.  You're everything to me. (she moves closer) Give me the gun.  Give me the gun and I'll do it for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paley stares at her -- his mind races.  Pain fills his fa he fights to make a decision.  Suddenly, his face tenses. starts to raise the gun at Dulaney -- then just as sudden turns it on Rebecca and FIRES. The bullet hits Rebecca in the chest.  The force blows he her feet. Paley stares at her blankly.  He slowly lowers the gun an drops it to the floor, then staggers over to Rebecca.

dialogues.speaker: ON REBECCA
dialogues.text: she stares up through glazed, dead eyes. Paley takes her pulse.  He breaks down, weeping over her his tears signaling to Dulaney that she is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police cars are lined up outside, their RED LIGHTS FLASHI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Members of the POLICE FORCE, along with FORENSIC PEOPLE g the area.  Dulaney sits on the couch.  He looks indiffere as if all emotion has been sucked out of him.  Troxell is beside him, taking notes.  Dulaney looks up. A BODYBAG on a stretcher is being wheeled out of the room Dulaney follows it with his eyes.  Cardenas enters from t bedroom.  They lock eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paley's confessed to the whole thing. It's like he's got no will to live now that she's gone. (thinks for a moment) She almost got away with it.  Ironic, huh?  Do you believe in karma, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- call it what you want.  Fate. Destiny.  We usually get what we deserve in the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.  Dulaney looks at him wearily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Troxell) You get his statement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney gets up and starts for the door.  Cardenas watche

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney turns around slowly.  Cardenas reaches into his RAINCOAT pocket and take out a VHS TAPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found this video in her room.  It has your name on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men lock eyes.  There is a long silence between t Dulaney waits for Cardenas' next move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding it out) I assume it's yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulaney knows that Cardenas has seen it.  A hint of a gra smile shows on his face.  He takes the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light RAIN falls.  Dulaney walks out and heads towards street.  He stops -- looks back at the condo -- then walk the street towards his car.
